comments:
Using posted build I20051114, right-click the example taipan.gmfmap file and
select "Create generator model..." and witness the following exception:

Error 2005-11-14 08:07:38.784 An internal error occurred during: "Create
generator model...".
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Attempted to beginRule:
F/org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.notation/src/model, does not match outer scope rule:
MultiRule[L/org.eclipse.gmf.examples.taipan/models/taipan.gmfmap,L/org.eclipse.gmf.examples.taipan/models/taipan.gmfgen]
at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.Assert.isLegal(Assert.java:58)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ThreadJob.illegalPush(ThreadJob.java:117)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ThreadJob.push(ThreadJob.java:226)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ImplicitJobs.begin(ImplicitJobs.java:81)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobManager.beginRule(JobManager.java:190)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.WorkManager.checkIn(WorkManager.java:96)
at
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.prepareOperation(Workspace.java:1660)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.refreshLocal(Resource.java:1258)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.File.refreshLocal(File.java:337)
at

org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.URIConverterImpl.createInputStream(URIConverterImpl.java:442)
at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.ResourceImpl.load(ResourceImpl.java:829)

org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.ResourceSetImpl.demandLoad(ResourceSetImpl.java:249)

org.eclipse.gmf.bridge.genmodel.BasicGenModelAccess.load(BasicGenModelAccess.java:113)
at
org.eclipse.gmf.bridge.genmodel.BasicGenModelAccess.ensure(BasicGenModelAccess.java:98)
at
org.eclipse.gmf.bridge.genmodel.BasicDiagramRunTimeModelHelper.loadGenModel(BasicDiagramRunTimeModelHelper.java:79)

org.eclipse.gmf.internal.codegen.popup.actions.TransformToGenModel$1.transform(TransformToGenModel.java:144)

Tepmorary fix (don't use scheduling rule at all) committed.
Besides, to clarify correct scenario for refreshing non-conflicting resources 
while job execution, question went to eclipse.platform newsgroup 
(news:dlaf0v$or6$1@news.eclipse.org)
Decreased Severity as it's no longer blocking.
Deffered. Need to open bugzilla against platform to make sure it's (not) a bug.
no scheduling rule at all for now
